Gde je i šta radi Dragan Ćeran? Osvaja trofeje, daje golove, Uzbekistan mu nudi da igra za reprezentaciju
Visoki centarfor blista pod komandom Šote Arveladzea

04 Nov 2019

Bliski istok je definitivno suđen Draganu Ćeranu. Nekadašnji napadač Smedereva, pažljivim ljubiteljima fudbala poznat po tome što je odigrao tačno 100 utakmica u dresu nekadašnjeg superligaša, proživljava neke od najlepših trenutaka karijere i lako bi moglo da se desi da kruna stigne u vidu poziva da zaigra za reprezentaciju – Uzbekistana!
Ćeran je trenutno član Pahtakora, ubedljivo najboljeg tima države, s kojim je krajem oktobra osvojio kup (strelac het-trika u finalu), u međuvremenu osigurao šampionski naslov, a sjajnu sezonu oplemenio je postigavši 23 gola na 22 prvenstvene utakmice. Dovoljno da skrene pažnju na sebe i da se u Taškentu pokrene pitanje dobijanja državljanstva Uzbekistana.
Kako mu je ovo četvrta sezona u Uzbekistanu (od 2016. do 2018. igrao za Nasaf), tokom 2020. ispuniće uslov za dobijanje pasoša, jer je potrebno pet godina da živi na teritoriji države kako bi postao njen državljanin. Čak lokalni mediji najavljuju da bi mogao i po ubrzanom postupku da uđe u proceduru i stekne šansu da zaigra za tamošnju selekciju. Naravno, ako ga to zanima...
Mediji u Uzbekistanu potenciraju da je zainteresovan da obuče dres njihovog državnog tim ai pomogne im u azijskim kvalifikacijama za plasman na Mundijal u Katar 2022, ali sam Ćeran izgleda nije za tu opciju.„Srećan sam u Uzbekistanu, međutim, promena državljanstva mi zasad nije u planu“, kratko je na tu temu rekao visoki 32-godišnji napadač, koji je za mladu reprezenatciju naše zemlje odigrao tri meča i dao jedan gol.
Posetimo, po odlasku iz srpskog fudbala, Dragan Ćeran je bio član belgijskog Vesterloa, izraelskog Hapoela iz Haiefe, Makabija iz Netanje, imao je epizode u Azerbejdžanu u Saudijskoj Arabiji, kao i Makedonij, ali je definitivno procvetao u Pahtakoru. Pod vođstvom nekadašnjeg reprezentativca Gruzije i asa Ajaksa i Rendžersa, Šote Arveladzea, dao je ukupno 28 i namestio još osam golova na 48 susreta za klub iz Taškenta.

Where and what is Dragan Ceran doing? He wins trophies, scores goals, Uzbekistan offers him to play for the national team
The high center shines under the command of Shota Arveladze

04 Nov 2019

The Middle East is definitely on trial for Dragan Ceran. The former Smederev striker, known to the careful football fan for playing exactly 100 games in a former Super League jersey, is experiencing some of the most beautiful moments of his career and it could easily happen that the crown comes in the form of invitations to play for the national team - Uzbekistan!
Ćeran is currently a member of Pahtakor, by far the best team in the country, with which he won the Cup (hat-trick shooter in the final) at the end of October, meanwhile securing the championship title, and refining his great season by scoring 23 goals in 22 championship games. Enough to draw attention to itself and raise the issue of Uzbek citizenship in Tashkent.
As this is his fourth season in Uzbekistan (from 2016 to 2018 he played for Nasaf), he will be eligible for a passport during 2020, as it takes him five years to live in the country to become a national. Even the local media announces that he could enter the procedure and get a chance to play for the selection there. Of course, if that's what interests him ...
The media in Uzbekistan have indicated that they are interested in training their national team jersey and helping them qualify for the Mundial Qatar 2022 qualification, but Ceran himself does not seem to be in the option. "I am happy in Uzbekistan, however, plan, "said the senior 32-year-old striker briefly on the subject, who played three matches for our country's young national team and scored one goal.
Let's visit, after leaving Serbian football, Dragan Ceran was a member of Belgium's Westerlo, Israeli Hapoel of Haiefe, Maccabi of Netanya, had episodes in Azerbaijan in Saudi Arabia, as well as Macedonia, but definitely flourished in Pahtakor. Led by former Georgia national team and Ajax and Rangers ace, Shota Arveladze, he has totaled 28 and scored eight more goals in 48 meetings for the Tashkent club.
